qc.notes: 10 poses received with bright indirect light, default lens. No filters or heavy makeup. Minor exposure variation between rooms.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: T-zone shows mild shine and more visible pores while cheeks/jaw appear matte with small pores. Texture is smooth overall, consistent with balanced oil in most areas.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated from overall medium-brown baseline across multiple angles; indoor daylight may slightly affect perceived depth.

skin_age_range.rationale: Minimal static lines and smooth texture suggest a late-30s appearance. Mild under-eye darkening and T-zone pores add minor age signals.

analysis.overview_explanation: Skin appears healthy and balanced with few lines. Primary opportunities are refining pores of the nose/medial cheeks, softening faint mottled spots on the cheeks/nose, and addressing mild under-eye darkness.

pores.rationale_plain: Pores are most visible on the nose and nearby medial cheeks. Elsewhere they remain small and sparse with a largely matte finish.
possible_causes: Natural T-zone oil can enlarge the appearance of pore openings under bright light.
Humid climate and product residue can emphasize pore edges.
Gradual elasticity changes with age may make pores look slightly more prominent.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024)

wrinkles.rationale_plain: Fine lines are faint on the forehead and at the outer eye with no deep or continuous tracks at rest. Expression lines do not persist strongly after movement.
possible_causes: Normal facial expressions create dynamic lines that can look visible in strong side lighting.
Sun exposure over time can gradually emphasize fine lines.
Natural elasticity changes with age make fine creases easier to see.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Small, scattered brown macules and light mottling are visible on the cheeks and nose. Overall tone is even across forehead and jaw.
possible_causes: Regular sun exposure can lead to scattered sun spots on exposed areas.
Past minor blemishes may leave faint marks that take longer to fade on Fitzpatrick IV skin.
Intermittent heat and UV can slightly deepen contrast of existing spots.

redness.rationale_plain: Mild, focal pinkness is present on the nose/alar area with neutral tones elsewhere. Pattern is localized and non-confluent.
possible_causes: Heat, rubbing, or cleansing can cause temporary central pinkness.
Humidity and temperature changes may accentuate capillary flush on the nose.
Products with fragrance or actives can occasionally cause short-lived redness.

texture.rationale_plain: Surface is smooth with a fine grain overall. Slight coarseness aligns with the T-zone and medial cheeks; no flaking is visible.
possible_causes: Sebum patterns and environmental humidity emphasize micro-relief in the T-zone.
Residue from sunscreen or cosmetics may accentuate grain if not fully removed.
Mild dehydration on certain days can highlight cross-hatching.

citations.title: Global photonumeric skin quality scale (Wiley OA)

acne.rationale_plain: No clear inflammatory lesions are seen. A few tiny comedonal candidates are present on the nose and chin in close views.
possible_causes: Occlusion, sweat, and sunscreen in humid weather can lead to occasional clogged pores.
Product residues left after cleansing may contribute to small comedones.
Normal hormonal fluctuations can cause intermittent comedone formation.

under_eye.rationale_plain: Clear but mild under-eye darkening is present, slightly more on the left. Borders remain within the eyelid area and there is minimal puffiness.
possible_causes: Genetic anatomy and tear-trough shadowing commonly contribute to darkness.
Sleep quality, screen time, and hydration can make the area appear darker on some days.

citations.title: Validated photonumeric scale for infraorbital dark circles (PMC)

region_summaries.summary_plain: Fine micro-relief with minimal lines and small pores. Tone is even and matte.
Calm skin with subtle expression creases only when moving. No focal discoloration.
Mild under-eye darkness with smooth texture; crow’s-feet minimal at rest.
Similar to left but slightly lighter; texture is smooth and even.
Even surface and mild mottling near the center; pores increase slightly toward the nose.
Mirrors the left cheek with small spots and modest pores medially; lateral cheek is smoother.
Most visible pores and slight pinkness; small comedonal candidates are present.
Even tone and very fine texture; lines at rest are minimal.
Generally smooth with small pores; occasional tiny comedonal candidates.
Low pore visibility and even tone; area appears calm.
Matches the left jaw—matte and even with low concern.

limitations: Indoor daylight can shift color balance slightly, affecting redness and pigmentation perception.
Nose ring mildly occludes a small area of the left nostril.
Under-eye depth and dynamic wrinkles are harder to judge without relaxed and smiling expression pairs.
